00020 #include <stdio.h>

00028 struct {
00029     logger_argtype type;
00030     const char   * str;
00031 } logger_argtype_strmap[] = {
00032     { logger_argtype_src,       "{SRC}"      },
00033     { logger_argtype_proxy,     "{PROXY}"    },
00034     { logger_argtype_ds_sport,  "{DS_SPORT}" },
00035     { logger_argtype_us_sport,  "{US_SPORT}" },
00036     { logger_argtype_ts,        "{TS}"       },
00037     { logger_argtype_ua,        "{UA}"       },
00038     { logger_argtype_meth,      "{METH}"     },
00039     { logger_argtype_uri,       "{URI}"      },
00040     { logger_argtype_proto,     "{PROTO}"    },
00041     { logger_argtype_status,    "{STATUS}"   },
00042     { logger_argtype_ref,       "{REF}"      },
00043     { logger_argtype_host,      "{HOST}"     },
00044     { logger_argtype_us_hdrval, "{US_HDR}:"  },
00045     { logger_argtype_ds_hdrval, "{DS_HDR}:"  },
00046     { logger_argtype_printable, NULL         },
00047 };
00048 
00049 void
00050 logger_log_request_tostr(logger_t * logger, request_t * request, evbuf_t * buf) {
00051     logger_arg_t       * arg;
00052     evhtp_request_t    * upstream_r;
00053     evhtp_connection_t * upstream_c;
00054     downstream_c_t     * downstream_c;
00055     downstream_t       * downstream;
00056     struct sockaddr_in * sin;
00057     int                  sres;
00058     char                 tmp[256];
00059 
00060     if (!logger) {
00061         return;
00062     }
00063 
00064     if (!request) {
00065         return;
00066     }
00067 
00068     if (!buf) {
00069         return;
00070     }
00071 
00072     if (!(upstream_r = request->upstream_request)) {
00073         return;
00074     }
00075 
00076     if (!(upstream_c = upstream_r->conn)) {
00077         return;
00078     }
00079 
00080     if (!(downstream_c = request->downstream_conn)) {
00081         return;
00082     }
00083 
00084     if (!(downstream = downstream_c->parent)) {
00085         return;
00086     }
00087 
00088     TAILQ_FOREACH(arg, &logger->args, next) {
00089         switch (arg->type) {
00090             case logger_argtype_us_hdrval:
00091                 if (arg->data == NULL) {
00092                     evbuffer_add(buf, "-", 1);
00093                 } else {
00094                     const char * hdr_val;
00095 
00096                     hdr_val = evhtp_header_find(upstream_r->headers_in, (const char *)arg->data);
00097 
00098                     if (hdr_val == NULL) {
00099                         evbuffer_add(buf, "-", 1);
00100                     } else {
00101                         evbuffer_add(buf, hdr_val, strlen(hdr_val));
00102                     }
00103                 }
00104                 break;
00105             case logger_argtype_ds_hdrval:
00106                 if (arg->data == NULL) {
00107                     evbuffer_add(buf, "-", 1);
00108                 } else {
00109                     const char * hdr_val;
00110 
00111                     hdr_val = evhtp_header_find(upstream_r->headers_out, (const char *)arg->data);
00112 
00113                     if (hdr_val == NULL) {
00114                         evbuffer_add(buf, "-", 1);
00115                     } else {
00116                         evbuffer_add(buf, hdr_val, strlen(hdr_val));
00117                     }
00118                 }
00119                 break;
00120             case logger_argtype_ds_sport:
00121                 evbuffer_add_printf(buf, "%d", downstream_c->sport);
00122                 break;
00123             case logger_argtype_us_sport:
00124                 sin = (struct sockaddr_in *)upstream_c->saddr;
00125 
00126                 evbuffer_add_printf(buf, "%d", ntohs(sin->sin_port));
00127                 break;
00128             case logger_argtype_src:
00129                 /* log the upstreams IP address */
00130                 sin = (struct sockaddr_in *)upstream_c->saddr;
00131 
00132                 evutil_inet_ntop(AF_INET, &sin->sin_addr, tmp, sizeof(tmp));
00133                 evbuffer_add(buf, tmp, strlen(tmp));
00134                 break;
00135             case logger_argtype_proxy:
00136                 /* log the downstreams host and port information */
00137                 sres = snprintf(tmp, sizeof(tmp), "%s:%d",
00138                                 downstream->config->host,
00139                                 downstream->config->port);
00140 
00141                 if (sres >= sizeof(tmp) || sres < 0) {
00142                     /* overflow condition, shouldn't ever get here */
00143                     logger_log_error(logger, "[CRIT] overflow in log_request!\n");
00144                     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00145                 }
00146 
00147                 evbuffer_add(buf, tmp, strlen(tmp));
00148                 break;
00149             case logger_argtype_ts:
00150             {
00151                 /* log an RFC compliant HTTP log timestamp */
00152                 time_t      t;
00153                 struct tm * tmtmp;
00154 
00155                 t     = time(NULL);
00156                 tmtmp = localtime(&t);
00157 
00158                 strftime(tmp, sizeof(tmp), "%d/%b/%Y:%X %z", tmtmp);
00159                 evbuffer_add(buf, tmp, strlen(tmp));
00160             }
00161             break;
00162             case logger_argtype_meth:
00163                 /* log the method of the request */
00164                 evbuffer_add(buf, htparser_get_methodstr(upstream_c->parser),
00165                              strlen(htparser_get_methodstr(upstream_c->parser)));
00166                 break;
00167             case logger_argtype_uri:
00168                 /* log the URI requested by the upstream */
00169                 if (upstream_r->uri && upstream_r->uri->path &&
00170                     upstream_r->uri->path->full) {
00171                     evbuffer_add(buf, upstream_r->uri->path->full,
00172                                  strlen(upstream_r->uri->path->full));
00173                 } else {
00174                     evbuffer_add(buf, "-", 1);
00175                 }
00176                 break;
00177             case logger_argtype_proto:
00178                 sres = snprintf(tmp, sizeof(tmp), "HTTP/%d.%d",
00179                                 htparser_get_major(upstream_c->parser),
00180                                 htparser_get_minor(upstream_c->parser));
00181 
00182                 if (sres >= sizeof(tmp) || sres < 0) {
00183                     /* overflow condition, shouldn't get here */
00184                     logger_log_error(logger, "[CRIT] overflow in log_request!\n");
00185                     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00186                 }
00187 
00188                 evbuffer_add(buf, tmp, strlen(tmp));
00189                 break;
00190             case logger_argtype_status:
00191                 sres = snprintf(tmp, sizeof(tmp), "%d",
00192                                 htparser_get_status(request->parser));
00193 
00194                 if (sres >= sizeof(tmp) || sres < 0) {
00195                     /* overflow condition, shouldn't get here */
00196                     logger_log_error(logger, "[CRIT] overflow in log_request!\n");
00197                     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00198                 }
00199 
00200                 evbuffer_add(buf, tmp, strlen(tmp));
00201                 break;
00202             case logger_argtype_ref:
00203             {
00204                 char * ref_str;
00205 
00206                 ref_str = (char *)evhtp_header_find(upstream_r->headers_in, "referrer");
00207 
00208                 if (!ref_str) {
00209                     ref_str = "-";
00210                 }
00211 
00212                 evbuffer_add(buf, ref_str, strlen(ref_str));
00213             }
00214             break;
00215             case logger_argtype_ua:
00216             {
00217                 char * ua_str;
00218 
00219                 ua_str = (char *)evhtp_header_find(upstream_r->headers_in, "user-agent");
00220 
00221                 if (!ua_str) {
00222                     ua_str = "-";
00223                 }
00224 
00225                 evbuffer_add(buf, ua_str, strlen(ua_str));
00226             }
00227             break;
00228             case logger_argtype_host:
00229             {
00230                 char * h_str;
00231 
00232                 h_str = (char *)evhtp_header_find(upstream_r->headers_in, "host");
00233 
00234                 if (!h_str) {
00235                     h_str = "-";
00236                 }
00237 
00238                 evbuffer_add(buf, h_str, strlen(h_str));
00239             }
00240             break;
00241             case logger_argtype_printable:
00242                 evbuffer_add(buf, arg->data, strlen(arg->data));
00243                 break;
00244         } /* switch */
00245     }
00246 }         /* logger_log_request_tostr */
00247 
00248 void
00249 logger_log_errorf(logger_t * logger, char * fmt, ...) {
00250     va_list ap;
00251 
00252     if (logger == NULL) {
00253         return;
00254     }
00255 
00256     va_start(ap, fmt);
00257     vfprintf(logger->errorlog, fmt, ap);
00258     va_end(ap);
00259 
00260     fprintf(logger->errorlog, "\n");
00261     fflush(logger->errorlog);
00262 }
00263 
00264 void
00265 logger_log_request_errorf(logger_t * logger, request_t * request, char * fmt, ...) {
00266     va_list   ap;
00267     evbuf_t * buf;
00268 
00269     if (!logger) {
00270         return;
00271     }
00272 
00273     if (!(buf = evbuffer_new())) {
00274         logger_log_error(logger,
00275                          "[CRIT] Could not create new evbuffer! %s\n",
00276                          strerror(errno));
00277         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00278     }
00279 
00280     logger_log_request_tostr(logger, request, buf);
00281     evbuffer_add(buf, "\0", 1);
00282 
00283     /* Write the error text first */
00284     va_start(ap, fmt);
00285     vfprintf(logger->errorlog, fmt, ap);
00286     va_end(ap);
00287 
00288     /* Write the request str */
00289     fprintf(logger->errorlog, ", %s\n", evbuffer_pullup(buf, -1));
00290     evbuffer_free(buf);
00291 }         /* logger_log_request_error */
00292 
00293 void
00294 logger_log_request(logger_t * logger, request_t * request) {
00295     evbuf_t * buf;
00296 
00297     if (!logger) {
00298         return;
00299     }
00300 
00301     if (!(buf = evbuffer_new())) {
00302         logger_log_error(logger,
00303                          "[CRIT] Could not create new evbuffer! %s\n",
00304                          strerror(errno));
00305         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00306     }
00307 
00308     logger_log_request_tostr(logger, request, buf);
00309 
00310     evbuffer_add(buf, "\0", 1);
00311     logger_write(logger, evbuffer_pullup(buf, -1));
00312 
00313     evbuffer_free(buf);
00314 }         /* logger_log_request */
00315 
00316 logger_argtype
00317 logger_argtype_fromstr(const char * str, int * arglen) {
00318     int i;
00319 
00320     for (i = 0; logger_argtype_strmap[i].str; i++) {
00321         const char   * s = logger_argtype_strmap[i].str;
00322         logger_argtype t = logger_argtype_strmap[i].type;
00323 
00324         if (!strncasecmp(s, str, strlen(s))) {
00325             *arglen = strlen(s);
00326 
00327             return t;
00328         }
00329     }
00330 
00331     return -1;
00332 }
00333 
00334 logger_arg_t *
00335 logger_arg_new(logger_argtype type) {
00336     logger_arg_t * a;
00337 
00338     if (type <= logger_argtype_nil) {
00339         return NULL;
00340     }
00341 
00342     if (!(a = calloc(sizeof(logger_arg_t), 1))) {
00343         return NULL;
00344     }
00345 
00346     a->type = type;
00347 
00348     return a;
00349 }
00350 
00351 int
00352 logger_arg_addchar(logger_arg_t * arg, const char c) {
00353     if (arg == NULL) {
00354         return -1;
00355     }
00356 
00357     if (arg->data == NULL) {
00358         if (!(arg->data = calloc(8, 1))) {
00359             return -1;
00360         }
00361 
00362         arg->len  = 8;
00363         arg->used = 0;
00364     }
00365 
00366     if ((arg->used + 2) >= arg->len) {
00367         if (!(arg->data = realloc(arg->data, arg->len + 16))) {
00368             return -1;
00369         }
00370 
00371         arg->len += 16;
00372     }
00373 
00374     arg->data[arg->used++] = c;
00375     arg->data[arg->used]   = '\0';
00376 
00377     return 0;
00378 }

00380 void *
00381 logger_syslog_open(void * largs) {
00382     int facility;
00383 
00384     if (largs == NULL) {
00385         facility = LOG_LOCAL7;
00386     } else {
00387         facility = *((int *)(largs));
00388     }
00389 
00390     openlog(NULL, LOG_NDELAY | LOG_PID, facility);
00391 
00392     return largs;
00393 }

00395 size_t
00396 logger_syslog_write(const char * str, void * arg) {
00397     if (str == NULL) {
00398         return 0;
00399     }
00400 
00401     syslog(LOG_INFO, "%s", str);
00402 
00403     return strlen(str);
00404 }
00405 
00406 void
00407 logger_syslog_close(void * arg) {
00408     closelog();
00409 }

00411 void *
00412 logger_file_open(void * largs) {
00413     const char * file;
00414     FILE       * fp;
00415 
00416     if (!(file = largs)) {
00417         return (void *)stdout;
00418     }
00419 
00420     if (!(fp = fopen(file, "a+"))) {
00421         fprintf(stderr, "Could not open file %s: %s\n",
00422                 file, strerror(errno));
00423         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00424     }
00425 
00426     return (void *)fp;
00427 }
00428 
00429 size_t
00430 logger_file_write(const char * str, void * arg) {
00431     FILE * fp;
00432     size_t len;
00433 
00434     if (!str) {
00435         return 0;
00436     }
00437 
00438     if (!(fp = arg)) {
00439         return 0;
00440     }
00441 
00442     len  = fwrite((void *)str, strlen(str), 1, fp);
00443     len += fwrite("\n", 1, 1, fp);
00444 
00445     fflush(fp);
00446 
00447     return len;
00448 }
00449 
00450 void
00451 logger_file_close(void * arg) {
00452     FILE * fp;
00453 
00454     if (!(fp = arg)) {
00455         return;
00456     }
00457 
00458     fclose(fp);
00459     return;
00460 }
00461 
00462 void *
00463 logger_open(logger_t * logger) {
00464     void * largs;
00465 
00466     if (!logger) {
00467         return NULL;
00468     }
00469 
00470     switch (logger->config->type) {
00471         case logger_type_file:
00472             largs = logger->config->filename;
00473             break;
00474         case logger_type_syslog:
00475             largs = &logger->config->syslog_facility;
00476             break;
00477         default:
00478             largs = NULL;
00479             break;
00480     }
00481 
00482     if (logger->fns.logger_open) {
00483         logger->fnarg = (logger->fns.logger_open)(largs);
00484     }
00485 
00486     return logger->fnarg;
00487 }
00488 
00489 size_t
00490 logger_write(logger_t * logger, const char * str) {
00491     if (logger && logger->fns.logger_write) {
00492         return (logger->fns.logger_write)(str, logger->fnarg);
00493     }
00494 
00495     return 0;
00496 }
00497 
00498 void
00499 logger_close(logger_t * logger) {
00500     if (logger->fns.logger_close) {
00501         return (logger->fns.logger_close)(logger->fnarg);
00502     }
00503 }
00504 
00505 logger_t *
00506 logger_init(logger_cfg_t * c) {
00507     logger_t   * logger;
00508     const char * strp;
00509 
00510     if (c == NULL) {
00511         return NULL;
00512     }
00513 
00514     if (!(logger = calloc(sizeof(logger_t), 1))) {
00515         return NULL;
00516     }
00517 
00518     logger->config = c;
00519 
00520     TAILQ_INIT(&logger->args);
00521 
00522     switch (c->type) {
00523         case logger_type_file:
00524             logger->fns.logger_open  = logger_file_open;
00525             logger->fns.logger_write = logger_file_write;
00526             logger->fns.logger_close = logger_file_close;
00527             break;
00528         case logger_type_syslog:
00529             logger->fns.logger_open  = logger_syslog_open;
00530             logger->fns.logger_write = logger_syslog_write;
00531             logger->fns.logger_close = logger_syslog_close;
00532             break;
00533         case logger_type_fd:
00534             break;
00535         default:
00536             break;
00537     }
00538 
00539     for (strp = c->format; *strp != '\0'; strp++) {
00540         logger_arg_t * larg   = NULL;
00541         int            insert = 0;
00542 
00543         if (*strp == '{') {
00544             int            arglen;
00545             logger_argtype type;
00546 
00547             if ((type = logger_argtype_fromstr(strp, &arglen)) < 0) {
00548                 return NULL;
00549             }
00550 
00551             if (!(larg = logger_arg_new(type))) {
00552                 return NULL;
00553             }
00554 
00555             strp  += arglen - 1;
00556             insert = 1;
00557 
00558             if (type == logger_argtype_us_hdrval || type == logger_argtype_ds_hdrval) {
00559                 if (*strp++ != ':') {
00560                     printf("Log format error\n");
00561                     return NULL;
00562                 }
00563 
00564                 if (*strp++ != '\'') {
00565                     printf("Log format error\n");
00566                     return NULL;
00567                 }
00568 
00569                 while (1) {
00570                     if (*strp != '\'') {
00571                         logger_arg_addchar(larg, *strp++);
00572                     } else {
00573                         break;
00574                     }
00575                 }
00576             }
00577         } else {
00578             if (TAILQ_EMPTY(&logger->args)) {
00579                 larg = NULL;
00580             } else {
00581                 larg = TAILQ_LAST(&logger->args, logger_args);
00582             }
00583 
00584             if (!larg || larg->type != logger_argtype_printable) {
00585                 if (!(larg = logger_arg_new(logger_argtype_printable))) {
00586                     return NULL;
00587                 }
00588 
00589                 insert = 1;
00590             }
00591 
00592             if (logger_arg_addchar(larg, *strp) != 0) {
00593                 return NULL;
00594             }
00595         }
00596 
00597         if (insert > 0) {
00598             TAILQ_INSERT_TAIL(&logger->args, larg, next);
00599         }
00600     }
00601 
00602     /* open error log */
00603     if (c->errorlog == NULL) {
00604         logger->errorlog = stderr;
00605     } else {
00606         logger->errorlog = fopen(c->errorlog, "a+");
00607 
00608         if (logger->errorlog == NULL) {
00609             fprintf(stderr, "Could not open errorlog %s\n", strerror(errno));
00610             exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00611         }
00612     }
00613 
00614     return logger;
00615 }     /* logger_init */
